markdownRemark.html:
First, I don’t recommend trying to change someone’s mind on a public forum. With that said, here is how I will try to conduct myself when people comment on something I have posted publicly.

  • If I respond, I will respond with courtesy. Even if we don’t agree we can still be courteous and try each other graciously.
  • I won’t delete your comment or reply unless it is harmful. While I know that may seem ambiguous what I am driving at is that discourse requires multiple view points. However, if you make comments that disparage based on race, sexual orientation, sexual identity, or other personal attributes then I will delete your comment if possible.

I would respectfully ask that you not comment and run. If you start a dialog let’s see it through to completion. There have been times when people made a comment and then virtually fled the scene. If you are unwilling to have a dialog then maybe you shouldn’t start one.

Please, feel free to start a dialogue and let’s keep it going.

frontmatter.title: Disourse on Social Platforms
frontmatter.description: My ideas on how I will conduct myself on social platforms
